00002 /** @file
00003  * Provide QueryPath with XSLT support using the PHP libxslt module.
00004  *
00005  * This is called 'QPXSL' instead of 'QPXSLT' in accordance with the name
00006  * of the PHP extension that provides libxslt support.
00007  *
00008  * You must have PHP XSL support for this to function.
00009  *
00010  * @author M Butcher <matt@aleph-null.tv>
00011  * @license http://opensource.org/licenses/lgpl-2.1.php LGPL or MIT-like license.
00012  * @see QueryPathExtension
00013  * @see QueryPathExtensionRegistry::extend()
00014  * @see QPXSL
00015  * @see QPXML
00016  */
00017  
00018 /**
00019  * Provide tools for running XSL Transformation (XSLT) on a document.
00020  *
00021  * This extension provides the {@link QPXSL::xslt()} function, which transforms
00022  * a source XML document into another XML document according to the rules in
00023  * an XSLT document.
00024  *
00025  * This QueryPath extension can be used as follows:
00026  * <code>
00027  * <?php
00028  * require 'QueryPath/QueryPath.php';
00029  * require 'QueryPath/Extension/QPXSL.php';
00030  *
00031  * qp('src.xml')->xslt('stylesheet.xml')->writeXML();
00032  * ?>
00033  *
00034  * This will transform src.xml according to the XSLT rules in 
00035  * stylesheet.xml. The results are returned as a QueryPath object, which 
00036  * is written to XML using {@link QueryPath::writeXML()}.
00037  * </code>
00038  *
00039  * @ingroup querypath_extensions
00040  */
00041 class QPXSL implements QueryPathExtension {
00042   
00043   protected $src = NULL;
00044   
00045   public function __construct(QueryPath $qp) {
00046     $this->src = $qp;
00047   }
00048   
00049   /**
00050    * Given an XSLT stylesheet, run a transformation.
00051    *
00052    * This will attempt to read the provided stylesheet and then
00053    * execute it on the current source document.
00054    *
00055    * @param mixed $style
00056    *  This takes a QueryPath object or <em>any</em> of the types that the 
00057    *  {@link qp()} function can take.
00058    * @return QueryPath
00059    *  A QueryPath object wrapping the transformed document. Note that this is a 
00060    *  <i>different</em> document than the original. As such, it has no history.
00061    *  You cannot call {@link QueryPath::end()} to undo a transformation. (However,
00062    *  the original source document will remain unchanged.)
00063    */
00064   public function xslt($style) {
00065     if (!($style instanceof QueryPath)) {
00066       $style = qp($style);
00067     }
00068     $sourceDoc = $this->src->top()->get(0)->ownerDocument;
00069     $styleDoc = $style->get(0)->ownerDocument;
00070     $processor = new XSLTProcessor();
00071     $processor->importStylesheet($styleDoc);
00072     return qp($processor->transformToDoc($sourceDoc));
00073   }
00074 }
